gurmukhi: GoirE qb KVgyS kau pwNfv sYn irswie ] pwrQ BIKm BIm idj dRaux kiRpw kur rwie ]1634]
transliteration: Gherio Tab Khadgesh Kau Paandav Sain Risaae|| Paarath Bheekham Bhij Dij Draoun Kridaa Kur Raae||1634||
translation: Then greatly infuriated, Arjuna, Bhishma, Bhima, Dronacharya, Kripacharya and Duryodhana etc. of the Pandava army besieged Kharag Singh.1634.

gurmukhi: jYsy bwr Kyq ko ju kwl Pws cyq ko su iB`C dwn dyq kau su kMkn ijau krkO ] jYsy dyh pRwn ko pÍyK ss Bwn ko AigAwn jYsy igAwn ko su gopI jYsy hir ko ]
transliteration: Jaise Baar Khet Ko Ju Kaal Phaas Chet Ko Su Bhichchh Daan Det Kau Su Kankan Jio Karkau|| Jaise Deh Praan Ko Pravesh Sas Bhaan Ko Agiaan Jaise Giaan Ko Su Gopijaise Har(i) Ko||
translation: Just as the fence surrounds the field, death surrounds the donor and the bangle surrounds the hand; just as the body surrounds the vital force Prana, the light surrounds the spheres of sun and moon, nescience surrounds knowledge and gopis surround Krishna

gurmukhi: ijau qVwg Awp kau su mwlw jYsy jwp kau su puMin jYsy pwp kau ijau Awl bwl qr kO ] jYsy auf DRUA kMau smuMdR jYsy BUA kMau su qYsy Gyir lIno hY KVg isM
transliteration: Jio Tadaag Aap Kau Su Maalaa Jaise Jaap Kau Su Pounn(i) Jaise Paap Kau Jio Aal Baal Tar Kau|| Jaise Ud Dhrooa Kaoun Dra Jaise Bhooa Kaoun Su Taise Gher(i) Leeno Hai Khadag Singh Bar Kau||1635||
translation: Just as the tank surrounds the water, the rosary surrounds the repetition of the name, the virtues surround the vices and the creeper surrounds the cucumber; just as the sky surrounds the pole star, the ocean surrounds the earth in the same way, these he

gurmukhi: Gyir lXo KVgyS jbY qb hI durjoDn kop BXo hY ] pwrQ BIm juiDStir BIKm Aaur hlIhl pwn lXo hY ]
transliteration: Gher(i) Layo Khadgesh Jabai Tab Hidurjodhan Ko Pbhayo Hai|| Paarath Bheem Judhishtar(i) Bheekham Aur Haleehal Paan Layo Hai||
translation: After surrounding Kharag Singh, Duryodhana was greatly enraged; Arjuna, Bhima, Yudhishtar and Bhishma took their weapons and Balram carried his plough;

gurmukhi: Bwnj dRaux ju Aaur kiRpw su kiRpwn ley Air Er gXo hY ] AqRn lwqn mUkn dwNqn ko qhw Awhv hoq BXo hY ]1636]
transliteration: Bhaanaj Draoun Ju Aur Kridaa Su Kridaan Lae Ar(i) Or Gado Hai|| Atran Laatan Moondan Daantan Ko Tahaa Aahav Hot Bhayo Hai||1636||
translation: Dronacharya, Kripacharya, Karana etc., have advanced towards the enemy and the dreadful fighting began with arms, legs, fists and teeth.1636.

gurmukhi: sRI KVgyS lXo Dnu bwn sMBwr keI Air koit sMGwry ] bwj pry khUM qwj igry gjrwj igry igr sy Dir kwry ]
transliteration: Srikhadgesh Layo Dhan(u) Baan Sanbhaar Kaiar(i) Kottee Sanhdare|| Baaj Dare Kahoon Taaj Gire Gadraaj Gire Gir Se Dhar(i) Kdare||
translation: Kharag Singh, holding his bow and arrows killed millions of enemies; somewhere horses, somewhere the black elephants like mountains have fallen down;

gurmukhi: Gwiel eyk prY qrPY su mno kr swXl isMG ibfwry ] eyk blI krvwrn so Air loQ prI iqh mUMf auqwry ]1637]
transliteration: Ghaail Ek Darai Tarphai Su Mano Kar Saayal Singh Biddare|| Ek Balikarvaaran So Ar(i) Loth Parimoondd Outdare||1637||
translation: Some of them, having fallen, are writhing like young one of an elephant crushed by lion and some of them are so powerful, who are severing the heads of the fallen corpses.1637.

gurmukhi: BUpq bwn kmwn ghI jdubIrn ky AiBmwn auqwry ] Pyir leI jmdwr sMBwr hkwr kY S`qRn ky aur Pwry ]
transliteration: Bhoopat Baan Kamaan Gadijadoubderan Ke Abhimaan Outdare|| Pher(i) Laijamdaar Sanbhaar Bakaar Kai Shattran Ke Ur Phdare||
translation: The king, taking up his bow and arrows pulverised the pride of Yadavas and then taking up the axe in his hand, he tore away the hearts of the enemies;

gurmukhi: Gwiel eyk igry rn mY Apny mn mY jgdIS sMBwry ] qy vh moK Bey qb hI Bv ko qr kY hir lok pDwry ]1638]
transliteration: Ghaail Ek Gire Ran Mai Apne Man Mai Jagdeesh Sanbhdare|| Te Vah Mokh Bhae Tab Hibhav Ko Tar Kai Har(i) Lok Badhdare||1638||
translation: The warriors, getting wounded in the war, are remembering the Lord in their mind; those who have died in the war, have attained salvation and they ferried across the dreadful ocean of samsara and gone to the abode of the Lord.1638.
